I'm glad someone wrote about it. Are we going to be a Republican-lite party or are we going to stand for real progressive values? This McCain courting has gotten out of hand. Sure, the polls indicate that a Kerry/McCain ticket would beat Bush/Cheney, but this is fundamentally the wrong approach to winning. We cannot as progressives allow the Democratic party to move more to the right. Clinton, through the DLC, moved the party to center. This allowed the Republicans to move even more to the right. This is dangerous for two reasons: Number One: the obvious reason being the right-wing Republicans in power. Number Two (and not so obvious): this leaves a vacuum on the progressive left. My hope is that the Clintonesque/DLC style of the Democratic party was an aberration of the 1990s. The only way to win back the White House (and the Senate and House) is to have a party that stands for real progressive values again. We know McCain is out, and that is a good thing. If Kerry picks a DINO like Evan Bayh and loses, don't say I didn't tell you so. We know what the Republican party stands for, but what do Democrats really stand for these days? The Democrats come November are going to be real sorry they sandbagged Howard Dean. more views here: urlLink http://www.commondreams.org/views04/0615-04.htm

Every month I get a newsletter from a firm in Chicago we have a business relationship with. It is usually full of random funnies and the like. It is simply sent out to remind us to call them once and awhile and perhaps do a little business....that's quite noble :) Enclosed with this newsletter is usually a toy or a trinket of some kind. As Independence Day approaches they felt it appropriate to send an American flag button. A nice gesture indeed. The pin says "Made in China" on the front of it below the flag, no joke. Don't you think it would have been more appropriate to stamp the "Made in China" on the back of this piece of cheap plastic with a small metal clasp attached to it? I am so amused by this because normally I wouldnt display an American flag. In this political climate displaying the flag reeks of a blind nationalism associated with the Iraq War and the Bushes....I think of the large American flags on the back of Chevy Tahoes and other highway leviathans. You know the type of people that love to drive these vehicles, the overweight middle-aged NASCAR-loving homophobes... The same men who flip me the bird and try to run me off the road after seeing my anti-Bush bumper sticker and HRC window decal on my Honda. These are the good Americans that love to display the American flag so prominently. However with this little pin, "Made in China" has earned a place on my desk. Perhaps this could be a good slogan going forward.... bumper stickers with the American Flag on them and "MADE IN CHINA" in very large lettering below, and with a website address.... some sort of website discussing free trade, globalization, and the like.
